content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-267-04-A
|Item_parent=Disorders of acid-base balance and fluid-electrolyte disorders
|Item_parent_short=Disorders of acid-base balance and fluid and electrolyte disorders
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the serious clinical abnormalities to look for
|Description=None
|Rubric=Identification of the emergency
|Contributors=P Rieu; B Moulin; M Flamant
|Order=4}}

Life-threatening if pH < 7.10 or bicarbonaemia < 8 mmol/L: reduced cardiac and tissue output, dyspnoea, catecholamine resistance, ventricular arrhythmias, inhibition of cellular metabolism and coma.

properties.question: At what pH level and bicarbonate concentration (mmol/L) does a patient's condition become life-threatening, potentially leading to reduced cardiac and tissue output, dyspnoea, catecholamine resistance, ventricular arrhythmias, inhibition of cellular metabolism, and coma?
